Primitive types

There are several primitive datatypes defined in tjsTypes.h.

tjs_int
signed integer(minimum 32bit)
tjs_uint
unsigned integer(minimum 32bit)
tjs_int8
8-bit signed integer
tjs_uint8
8-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int16
16-bit signed integer
tjs_uint16
16-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int32
32-bit signed integer
tjs_uint32
32-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int64
64-bit signed integer
tjs_uint64
64-bit unsigned integer
tjs_char
Wide char (used as a TJS2 string primitive type)
tjs_nchar
Narrow char
tjs_real
real (double)
tTVInteger
same as tjs_int64
tTVReal
same as tjs_real

tTJSString

　The tTJSString type is a string type used in TJS2 and handles zero-terminated strings of the tjs_char type. It is defined in tjsString.cpp/tjsString.h. It is also available with the short model name ttstr.
　This type automatically manages the memory for character strings and has a high affinity with the tTJSVariant type.

eTJS

　The eTJS type is the basic type of C++ exception objects. It is defined in tjsError.h. There is a method called GetMessage that allows you to get the message string thrown with the exception. 。

TJS_W

　A macro for converting string literals to the tjs_char * type.

Usage: TJS_W("string literal")
